title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4202.12 - Punishment of violations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4202.12 - Punishment of violations

State Regulations

Violation of any rule or regulation or order or directive
of the commission, whether or not a penalty is fixed in the rules and
regulations, or in such order or directive is punishable in the discretion of
the commission by revocation or suspension of a license and exclusion from all
racing enclosures under the jurisdiction of the commission. A violation by the
holder of a track license in conducting a racing meeting may be punishable by
revocation, suspension or denial of a future license or by
fine. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4202.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
